ua.khpi.hrynevych.task03.subtask05

Class Subtask05

  • java.lang.Object
    • ua.khpi.hrynevych.task03.subtask05.Subtask05

  • public final class Subtask05
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods for converting numbers between decimal and roman notations. Operating range of the class methods consists of numbers between 1 and 100 inclusive in decimal notation. Working with numbers not from specified range may cause unexpected results.
    Version:
    1.0, 17 Nov 2017
    Author:
    Hrynevych Pavlo

    • Method Detail

      • getPart

        private static java.lang.String getPart(char current,
                                        char next5,
                                        char next10,
                                        int number)
        Returns representation of specified number of units in a specified digit place in roman notation. Having some number splitted into digits, you can get roman notation of each digit place using this method. Parameter number correspond to the number of units in digit place, roman notation of which is needed. E.g. number 43 has 4 units in tens digit place and 3 units in units digit place. Parameters current, next5 and next10 define roman representation of needed digit place. Parameter current defines a char that represents one unit of needed digit place in roman notation. Parameters next5 and next10 correspond to five and ten units of current digit place, respectively. E.g. for getting roman notation of units in the number 43 you use current = 'I', next5 = 'V', next10 = 'X', number = 3. And for getting tens: current = 'X', next5 = 'L', next10 = 'C', number = 4.
        Parameters:
        current - symbol representing one unit of current digit place in roman notation
        next5 - symbol representing five units of current digit place in roman notation
        next10 - symbol representing ten units of current digit place in roman notation
        number - number of units in current digit place to represent in roman notation
        Returns:
        roman notation of specified digit place

      • decimal2Roman

        public static java.lang.String decimal2Roman(int x)
        Returns roman representation of the decimal number in parameter. Method works for numbers between 1 and 100 inclusively.
        Parameters:
        x - number to represent in roman notation
        Returns:
        roman notation of specified number

      • getValue

        private static int getValue(char input)
        Returns decimal value that character in the parameter represent in roman notation. Method works for symbols representing numbers between 1 and 100 inclusively. Other symbols will result 0.
        Parameters:
        input - symbol of roman notation
        Returns:
        decimal number corresponding to the specified symbol

      • roman2Decimal

        public static int roman2Decimal(java.lang.String s)
        Returns decimal value corresponding to the roman number in the parameter. If input string is null, empty or can't be considered as a roman number then -1 is returned. Also -1 is returned when result is bigger then 100 or less then 1.
        Parameters:
        s - roman number
        Returns:
        decimal value of specified roman number
